questions.question: The three triumvirs after the death of Caesar are...

choices.answer: Brutus , Cassius and Casca
Antony, Lepidus and Octavius
Antony, Popilius and Octavius
Brutus, antony and Octavius

questions.question: Antony compares Lepidus with a ...

choices.answer: great king of the past
great famous general in Rome
Caesar himself
valiant and obedient horse

questions.question: What is the attitude of Brutus towards Cassius in Act IV, scene 2?

choices.answer: He questions Cassius's commitment and he is cautious
He is eager to meet him to prepare their strategy
He awaits for his wise, keen perception
He feels relieved that Cassius has finally arrived

questions.question: What has happened to Portia?

choices.answer: She was imprisioned by Antony
She was killed by the mob
She committed suicide
She fled Rome to meet Brutus in Sardine

questions.question: Of what does Brutus accuse Cassius?

choices.answer: of killing Lucius Pella
of taking bribes
of being a coward
of taking Antony's side

questions.question: How does Brutus face Portia's death?

choices.answer: Very mournful and weeping in his tent
With incontrollable anger which breaks his friendship
Mourns in private, but remains a stoic leader for his army
Sadly, shows defeat and concern

questions.question: When Caesar's Ghost says "thou shall see me at Plillippi" foreshadows that...

choices.answer: Brutus will face the Ghost in battle
The Ghost will lead the army
The Ghost is the actual enemy
Brutus will die in Philippi

questions.question: The Ghost's phrase "Thy evil spirit" could mean...

choices.answer: Brutus is a really evil man
Cassius's mean manipulation
Brutus's guilty conscience
Caesar's view of the conspirators

questions.question: What is the virtue and what is the flaw of the tragic hero?

choices.answer: Bravery and ambition
Honor and idealism
Loyalty and pride
Observation and generosity

questions.question: How does Cassius die?

choices.answer: with his eyes covered, stabbed by his slave
stabbed by the enemy's sword
facing the dagger that had stabbed Caesar
running against his sword, held by his servant

questions.question: How does Brutus die?

choices.answer: stabbed by the enemy's sword
facing the dagger that had stabbed Caesar
running against his sword, held by his servant
with his eyes covered, stabbed by his slave

questions.question: Why is the day of the battle at Philippi, a special day?

choices.answer: Portia has just died
It is Cassius's birthday
It is the first time Caesar's Ghost appears
Antony accepts the second Triumvirate

questions.question: What is Cassius's misunderstanding when watching the field from afar?

choices.answer: He thought that it was Brutus's army coming in triumphant
He thought he saw fire in his tents
He thinks that Titinus has been captured
He came to the wrong post

questions.question: What are Brutus's last words?

choices.answer: Then fall Caesar!
Caesar, now be still. I killed thee with half so good a will.
Farewell, good Strato
Let's all cry "Peace, freedom and liberty!!"

questions.question: How does Antony refer to Brutus's character as he sees his corpse?

choices.answer: As a flatterer and a villain
A man with bad strokes but good words
His life was gentle...This was a man.
He was Caesar's angel

questions.question: How can we describe Cassius's death?

choices.answer: an honorable and respected death
a lonely and dishonorable death
a coward betrayal
a soldier's death

questions.question: How can we describe Brutus's death?

choices.answer: dishonored by his actions, a shame to Rome
betrayed by his best friend, alone and forgotten
as an honorable Roman and well respected by many
a cowardly carried out death

questions.question: Does Antony seem to understand Brutus's motives?

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What does Octavius say about Brutus's death?

choices.answer: He believes that Caesar's ghost will find peace
He orders the rituals of an honorable soldier's burial
He says the other conspirators shall join him in his fate
He orders his servant to bury him.

questions.question: What are the main characteristics of a true tragedy outcome?

choices.answer: A catharsis filled with sorrow but uplifting idea about the human spirit
A disaster where everyone dies including the main character
Death prevails and kills beauty
The hero dies and everyone hates him
